note.p: Birth: Elston Hall, Nottinghamshire, England (12 December 1731)
Death: Breadsall Priory, Derbyshire (18 April 1802)
Profession: Physician
Poet
Research Field: Medicine, scientific poetry, botany, technology
Education: Chesterfield School (1741-1750); St John's College, Cambridge; Edinburgh Medical School. MB (1755); MD (Edinburgh)

Career: First medical practice in Nottingham, moved to Lichfield, Staffordshire; member of the Lunar Society; many inventions, including a vertical-axis windmill, used in Josiah Wedgwood's (FRS 1783) factory; moved to Radbourne Hall with his second wife, because she disliked Lichfield.
Freemason, member, Lodge St David No 36, Edinburgh
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 9/04/1761
